data.title: Trending Instagram Reels Songs (August 2024)
data.meta_description: Your source for trending Reels songs (updated monthly) to ensure your Instagram Reels strategy is always up to date on popular sound trends in 2024.
data.text:
âTips on How To Find Trending Songs on Instagram Reels.

Sometimes, you just need a song that enhances your Reel â whether this is a song that matches whatever you highlight in your Reel, or simply provides a pleasant background atmosphere.Â

Here are some tips to find trending Instagram songs:Â

Look outside of Instagram: You might not be exposed to every song that presents a good opportunity for your brand. Fortunately, there are many Spotify playlists that round up the most popular songs on Reels, and this could spark an idea for your Instagram marketing strategy.

Use âOriginal audioâ: Be sure to only use trending videos with the âOriginal audioâ label, which means brands can use them.Â â

Pay attention to audio permission: As a brand on Instagram, there are certain songs and audio not available â donât use sounds with the âThis sound isnât licensed for commercial useâ label.

Tips on How To Find Trending Audio on Reels.

Wondering how to find trending Reels audio? Follow these steps to help you stay on top of trending sounds on Reels for your brand:Â

Pay attention to TikTok trending sounds: Sometimes these sounds trend on TikTok and Reels simultaneously, but sometimes they trend on Reels days or weeks after they appear on TikTok.Â

Donât be afraid to be an early adopter: Donât let the fact that an audio has a lower number of uses than you might be used to seeing. For growing trends, this often means the sound isnât overly saturated â yet. Follow trends, but donât be afraid to set them.Â â

Pay attention to Instagramâs recommendations: While marketers might know this, itâs worth noting that thereâs an arrow next to trending Instagram songs on the Reels Explore page that tells you if an audio is trending, and recommend related trending audio for you to use.

Popular Reels Songs - August 2024

As Summer comes to a close, here are the songs trending on Instagram Reels this month.Â

Finesse - Michael Prince ft. Koncept P, willnosleep & avonosleep (3K Reels)

This is a trending song for Instagram Reels thatâs perfect for showing off. It contains strings and a long intro, where the phrase âdo you not get the concept?â is said. This audio is used to show progress, cars and anything that youâd like to show off.Â

Ice Cream Sunday (Instrumental) - Floss (170K Reels)Â

This is an upbeat instrumental, perfect for nearly any positive Reels content. Use it to show off travel destinations, beauty looks or anything else worth showcasing.Â

Â Big Dawgs - Hanumankind (1.2M Reels)

âBig Dawgsâ is an energetic hip-hop track that blends powerful lyrics with a hard-hitting beat, making it a perfect choice for hype videos. It's rapidly gaining popularity on Instagram Reels, with users leveraging its intense vibe for everything from recipes to workouts and more.

Popular Reels Songs - July 2024

Which songs are trending for Instagram Reels this month? Here are some songs to incorporate in your Reels content.

Please Please Please - Sabrina Carpenter (479K Reels)Â

âPlease Please Pleaseâ by Sabrina Carpenter is taking the internet by storm. This song is catchy and perfect for nearly any Reels content â however, this audio makes a strong statement when paired with a âpleaâ of your own.Â

The girl, so confusing version with Lorde - Charli XCX (7.2K)Â

As if âGirl, so confusingâ couldnât get any better â Charli XCX asked Lorde to work it out on the remix, and they sure did. This song is perfect for any content centred around the complexities of being a woman, but can also be used for most types of Reels content, like behind-the-scenes footage, hauls or styling videos.Â

Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight) - Abba (180K Reels)Â

This pop classic is trending on Reels this summer, and is the perfect song to accompany travel content. Itâs cheery, fast-temo sound is also perfect for any content that shows your team or friends having a ball.Â Â

Chihiro (gravagerz remix) - Billie Eilish (88.6K Reels)Â

Half of the songs from Billie Eilishâs third studio album are trending across social media â this time, with a remix of âChihrioâ. This remix puts a sped-up, upbeat spin on the song, making it perfect for POVs, how toâs and more.Â Â

Good Luck, Babe! - Chappell Roan (46.3K Reels)Â

From Charli to Chappell, Summer 2024 is shaping up to be for the pop girls â and of course, this means âGood Luck, Babe!â is trending on Instagram, across a variety of Reels content. Use this to celebrate LGBQT+ pride (regardless if pride month is over or not), Chappell Roan-inspired makeup looks and more.

Trending Reels Songs - June 2024

As we move into Summer, these are the Reels songs shaping Explore pages everywhere.Â

MILLION DOLLAR BABY - (1M Reels)Â

This song, 'MILLION DOLLAR BABY' is the perfect upbeat track to back almost any Reels content, from recipes and DIYs to OOTDs. Pair this trending song with the appropriate Instagram hashtag for optimal reach.Â

BIRDS OF A FEATHER - Billie Eilish (214K Reels)

Songs from Billie Eilishâs new album are trending across Instagram and TikTok. 'BIRDSÂ OFÂ AÂ FEATHER' is a light, airy and calm song thatâs suitable for nearly any content â or, stick with the songâs theme and use for content showing your favorite pairing, from complimentary products to your office pal.

Cheri Cheri Lady - Modern Talking (69.1K Reels)

This song can be found under âChery Chery Lady Showâ, and is an â80âs pop hit thatâs recently resurfaced on Instagram Reels. Despite itâs distinct 80âs song and French lyrics, this song is suitable for all genders and nearly any type of content.Â

misses - Dominic Fike (49.6K Reels)

This May release, 'misses' from Dominic Fike's album '14 minutes' (which is â you guess it â 14 minutes long), is picking up steam on Instagram Reels this June, with the song trending in travel, fashion, food content and more. Itâs an emotional song with a catchy rhythm â perfect for Summertime listening, and your Reels content.Â

Trending Reels Songs - May 2024

Curious which songs are being used across Instagram Reels this May? These are the trends taking shake on Instagramâs Explore pages this month.Â

Too Sweet - Hozier (432K Reels)Â

This trending song, 'Too Sweet' by Hozier, is being used in a wide variety of Instagram Reel content â use it to back OOTDs, POVs or recipes. Another popular use for this audio is to share a carousel in a Reel, featuring a glow-up â this can be your own, or even a product from your brand thatâs gotten a facelift.Â

Espresso - Sabrina Carpenter (596K Reels)Â

Hopefully no oneâs working late â but Sabrina Carpenter is! This catchy, likely-to-be-song-of-the-summer, 'Espresso', can be used in almost any Reels content you want to post, from product flatlays, to styling inspiration and more.Â

everybody wants to rule the world - The Free Label (110K Reels)Â

This funky, lowkey (yet upbeat!) song is perfect for capturing âday in the lifeâ content, POV and many other IG Reels trends. Since the trending song segment is an instrumental, itâs fitting for almost any type of Reel youâd like to publish.

Fortnight ft. Post Malone (141K Reels)Â

This new release, 'Fortnight', featuring Post Malone and Taylor Swift from her recent release, âThe Tortured Poetâs Departmentâ, is trending across Reels â and with fewer views than some of her other hits, making this a great song to use across your content before it becomes oversaturated.

Trending Reels Songs - April 202â4

These are the Reels songs trending across Instagram in April â this monthâs trending songs fit a wide range of content that nearly any industry can tap into.

i like the way you kiss me - Artemas (783K Reels)

Use this new song 'i like the way you kiss me' by Atemas for every type of content from OOTDs, like the example shown below, showcase product or any content about love.Â

Little Simz - GorillaÂ (25.5KÂ Reels)

This song, Little Simz, has a strong, horn-filled opening, before opening into its funky, fun lyrics. Itâs perfect for a big announcement, but suits almost any type of Reels content.Â Â

the boy is mine - Ariana GrandeÂ (92.2KÂ Reels)

This interpolation of the Monica and Brandy song âthe boy is mineâ is suitable not just for love or relationship-centric content, but any type of

Sunday Morning (Cover) - MEAGAN DE LIMEÂ (5.6KÂ Reels)

Sunday Morning is an easy-listening, relaxing â yet slightly faster-paced cover of Maroon 5âs Sunday Morning, thatâs best for any type of easy, breezy Reels footage, from DIYs to styling inspiration.

Trending Reels Songs - March 2024

These are the songs and sounds making an impact across Instagram in March.Â

I Feel Love - Sam Smith (156K Reels)

This Sam Smith hit from 2019 is trending once again on Reels â this vibrant, modern track with an old-school feel is being used in recipe, beauty, fashion content and more.

yes, and? - Ariana GrandeÂ (415KÂ Reels)

Ariana Grandeâs newest single is the perfect, catchy song to back your Reels content, or to use Reels content responding to unwanted questions.Â

Pink Matter - Frank Ocean ft. Andre the Giant (8KÂ Reels)

Despite being around for the past 14 years, Frank Oceanâs song âPink Matterâ is trending on Reels again. The drop in the song and the catchy beat makes it a great audio option for editing, particularly to showcase a variety of outfits, beauty looks or anything else you can think of.Â

Saturday Love - Cherrelle O. ft. Alexander OâNealÂ (29.9KÂ Reels)

This song, 'Saturday Love', lists the days of the week, making it perfect to showcase a weekâs worth of content. The songâs lyrics and disco-vibes also make it perfect for Reels content celebrating your weekend adventures.

Glamorous, Original Audio (34.7K Reels)

This song uses incorporates Nikki Minajâs FTCU lyrics âhigh heels on my tippiesâ, before transforming into Fergieâs hit âGlamorousâ. This is the perfect sound for nearly any luxury Reels content.

Reels Trends - August 2024

Whatâs trending on Instagram Reels this August?

Girls Canât DunkÂ

This is a fun trend that only requires a quick outfit change. This trend is often used by a male and female duo, but feel free to adjust it to what works best for your participants. In the trend, the more athletic person says (with a matching text overlay) âgirls canât dunkâ, or a similarly challenging athletic feat. In the next shot, film the other person saying something to the effect of âwatch meâ. Then, have the athletic person switch to the other personâs clothing and complete the dunk, shot, flip or whatever else.Â

Youâre My Friend Now

This is the perfect trend to do with your office bestie and share your internal teamâs personality. This is simple â lipsynch âyouâre my friend nowâ to this audio and show your followers how fast you and your office bestie clicked.

Reels Trends - July 2024

Curious which trends (and related audio) are trending across the Instagram Explore page? Here are some trends to try this July.

Iâm Feeling Rough

This emerging trend uses a line from the MGMT song âTime to Pretendâ, âIâm feeling rough / Iâm feeling rawâ. To partake in this trend, use the associated sound and use the text feature to describe a situation that makes you feel âroughâ.Â Â

Match My Freak

This trend has been taking over TikTok, and is more âsafe-for-workâ than you might think â to partake in this trend, simply use this audio and use the text feature to describe an activity or behavior youâd like to find in someone else, or simply just something unique or silly thatâs habit for you.

Realizing ThingsÂ

This trend is simple to partake in â simply use this audio thatâs reminiscent of someone blinking, then use the text feature to describe a recent realization youâve had, or simply something that shocked you.

Pretty Woman

This trend uses a cover of Roy Orbinsonâs âOh, Pretty Womanâ, and is perfect for beauty or fashion brands. Use this trend to show off beauty trends, hairstyles (like the example below), styling ideas or more.

Rapid-Fire Pictures and VideosÂ

Use this audio, âForget Youâ, and share a succession of rapid-fire photos or videos. This format is perfect for âday in my lifeâ content, Summer re-caps, travel inspiration or almost anything else you have lots of content on.

Trending Audio on Instagram - June 2024Â

Weâve covered which songs are trending on Instagram Reels, but what about the trends? Hereâs what people are playing with on Reels this month.Â

What Are You Addicted To?Â

This song begins with an audio sample of an interviewer asking, âWhat are you addicted to?â before delving into a rap song. To partake in this trend, share a video or image with a text overlay that reads âWhat are you addicted to?â or âWhat Iâm addicted toâ â when the beat drops, share a succession of images featuring your addiction.Â

âLetâs Dance!âÂ

This song originates from an Oscarâs appearance by Emma StoneÂ â in the clip, Emma Stone presents Oscar nominees with Ben Stiller, and asks Jonah Hill to dance onstage. This part of the clip was remixed online into a catchy song, thatâs being used across TikTok and Instagram in a variety of content.Â

Whatâs In My Bag

No, itâs not original YouTube â âwhatâs in my bagâ content has been trending quite a bit in recent times. The most recent iteration? A flatlay of your bagâs goodies, labeled for your audience.Â

Take A Look Around

This trend comes courtesy of the movie Uptown Girls â the audio is spoken by a young Dakota Fanning, who says âDo you see her anywhere? Take a look around, youâre not gonna.â Either lipsynch to the sound or use the outline of Fanning herself saying it, with a text overlay detailing something youâre not going to âsee aroundâ â like a problem your brand provides a solution for, perhaps.Â

Trending Audio on Instagram - May 2024Â

Here are the audio trends being used on Instagram Reels this May.Â

Cara Delevigne on GTA Radio

This audio hails from the Play Station game âGrand Theft Autoâ, where Cara Delevigne provided audio for a radio DJ. While this audio can be used in the background of other content, try using it to feature something you love while lipsynching to the words, âitâs time you fell in love with something that will love you backâ.Â

Blue MondayÂ

This trend originated from TikTok, and has quickly began trending on Instagram. In this trend, creators use the song âBlue Mondayâ by Above & Beyond (the extended mix), while taking an old-school video game âfighting stanceâ. To the beat of the music, add a text overlay that communicates a common discussion or disagreement you have with a friend or colleague.Â

POV

This original audio is on trend, and being used across a variety of content â one of the most popular trends being used on this audio is the âPOVâ trend, where users share a perspective from their life to share with their followers.Â

Trending Audio on Instagram - April 2024Â

These are the trends and corresponding audio users are adding to their content to increase reach and play with trends.Â

Hello SharksÂ

This a fun Reels trend that involves asking the Shark Tank âsharksâ for an investment â but not necessarily for a business idea, but something silly and fun. Use this opportunity to plug your best-selling products, or make another cheeky joke.Â

âAudio: Hello Sharks

Happy Girl EraÂ

Have you been taking care of yourself and prioritizing your needs? Use this trending audio for any content that centers around self care, from health and wellness, beauty and skincare and even travel.Â

âAudio: Happy Girl Era

2000âs Rom-ComÂ

Use this audio to enact any moment that makes you feel like a characters straight out of a mid-2000âs romcom. This can range from anything to simply reading a book, like the example below, or even just crossing the street.

Audio: Built This Way - Samantha Ronson

Trending Audio on Instagram - March 2024Â

These trending sounds are shaping the Instagram Explore page this March.Â

Thank You So Much for 20 Followers (11.8K Reels)Â

Use this audio, which says âthank you so much for 20 followersâ, as a tongue-in-cheek way to celebrate getting your Instagram brand off the ground, creating your first Reels or even to poke fun at a social media post you thought would help you go viral on Instagram.

Your Destination is CallingÂ (145KÂ Reels)

This trending audio featuring a ringtone turned beat drop, is perfect to showcase exotic travel destinations â to start, share a brief video of your travel destination (during the âdial toneâ portion of the audio), before the beat drops. Then, using the âFast Picturesâ or other CapCut template, share a rapid-fire selection of photos from your trip.Â

Exactly What Iâm Going For (5K Reels)Â

To use the 'exactly what I'm going for' audio and its corresponding trend, simply use text to describe something thatâs become your entire personality. Use the phrasing, âIf youâre not careful, ___ will become your whole personality,â with a corresponding photo or video.Â

How Dash Hudson Can Help Schedule and Auto Publish Your Reels

One of the challenges of staying on top of trends is the 24/7 nature of social media â and even social marketers and managers need a break.Â

Dash Hudsonâs Multi-Channel Social Media Scheduler feature makes it easy to stay on top of trends, and avoid any rush. When your boss inevitably reaches out about that new audio trend they read about or scrolled by, you have the pleasure of telling them itâs already in the pipeline.Â

In addition to the Scheduler feature, Dash Hudsonâs AI powered tools for automation and insights help with repetitive tasks and decision making, allowing you more time for making creative Reels that your audience will love.

FAQs

How do I find trending audio on Instagram?

You can find trending audio on Instagram by navigating to the Audio tool in Reels, and searching through the Instagram audio library â look for arrows that indicate an audio is trending.Â

What is the most used audio on Reels?

One of the most used audio on Reels is âAs it Wasâ by Harry Styles with 3.4 million uses, and âWait a Minuteâ (Remix) by DJ Exe is the second-most used Instagram Reels song at 1.3 million uses.Â
